[REDACTED_NAME] usually reaches us complaining about the [REDACTED_NAME]-[REDACTED_NAME] network (low performance, frequent disconnections and others).
[REDACTED_NAME] the troubleshoot, we check that there is some [REDACTED_NAME]-[REDACTED_NAME] APs that cannot be reached on the network. [REDACTED_NAME] ask customer to restart, check MACs, and more...
 
[REDACTED_NAME] issue is caused because the [REDACTED_NAME]-[REDACTED_NAME] APs returned to the factory default IP (192.168.0.50) or even returned to all factory settings after a power cycle. [REDACTED_NAME] vessel have at least three APs, they started to conflict between them because of the equal IP, leading to disconnections and other issues.
 
[REDACTED_NAME] below the procedure to access the [REDACTED_NAME]-[REDACTED_NAME] APs over their factory IP and restore their access over the LAN2 configured network (note that this procedure will lead to total disconnection of the [REDACTED_NAME]-[REDACTED_NAME] network on the vessel over the time spent on the configurations - around 1h, depending on the connection speed).

.

[REDACTED_NAME], assign this LAN to the LAN2 interface and restart the XChange [REDACTED_NAME].

 -

admin
. password can be 
stddzWIFI 
or
